channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12905] Issue with mapjoin in tez under certain conditions
item.description: In a specific case where we have an outer join followed by another join on the same key and the non-outer side of the outer join is empty, hive-on-tez produces incorrect results.
item.summary: Issue with mapjoin in tez under certain conditions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Nit: if (writeHelper == null) { check should not be necessary, right?

Also do MR and Spark HashtableLoaders use putRow too? I don't recall, they need to be updated if they do.

Otherwise +1 pending tests.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12783664/HIVE-12905.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12784217 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Latest patch looks good to me. The only failing test of concern is the new test under mapreduce (TestCliDriver). I think the results actually match but the diff may be in the tab/space.
Committed with the whitespace fix for the test.

sershe Removing 1.2.2 from target version as this patch will need few others (e.g. HIVE-11262, HIVE-11182 etc) and I'm not sure we should backport all. If there is a patch for 1.2 before release, we can always incorporate that; let me know if you feel otherwise.
